intro: Thelypteris bermudiana, commonly known as Bermuda shield fern, is a species of fern native to Bermuda and parts of the Caribbean. It belongs to the family Athyriaceae and is characterized by its shield-shaped fronds. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and rocky crevices. Its rhizomes are fibrous and help anchor it to the substrate. Thelypteris bermudiana is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in stabilizing soil in coastal areas.
